item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 19, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (526 points | 300 comments)
2. Zod 4 (374 points | 136 comments)
3. Show HN: Windows 98 themed website in 1 HTML file for my post punk band (57 points | 10 comments)
4. Claude Code SDK – Anthropic (58 points | 24 comments)
5. Launch HN: Better Auth (YC X25) – Authentication Framework for TypeScript (129 points | 45 comments)
6. Too Much Go Misdirection (94 points | 29 comments)
7. Remarks on AI from NZ (52 points | 21 comments)
8. European Investment Bank to inject €70B in European tech (159 points | 155 comments)
9. Game theory illustrated by an animated cartoon game (46 points | 7 comments)
10. Glasskube (YC S24) is hiring in Vienna to build Open Source deployment tools ( | hide)
11. ClawPDF – Open-Source Virtual/Network PDF Printer with OCR and Image Support (137 points | 22 comments)
12. Wikipedia's Most Translated Articles (51 points | 30 comments)
13. InventWood is about to mass-produce wood that's stronger than steel (387 points | 366 comments)
14. Kelp – simple replacement for homebrew on macOS (44 points | 20 comments)
15. Run your GitHub Actions locally (30 points | 14 comments)
16. Microsoft's ICC blockade: digital dependence comes at a cost (44 points | 7 comments)
17. The forbidden railway: Vienna-Pyongyang (2008) (7 points | discuss)
18. Telum II at Hot Chips 2024: Mainframe with a Unique Caching Strategy (104 points | 43 comments)
19. Side projects I've built since 2009 (202 points | 115 comments)
20. Company Reminder for Everyone to Talk Nicely About the Giant Plagiarism Machine (27 points | 9 comments)
21. 23andMe Sells Gene-Testing Business to DNA Drug Maker Regeneron (140 points | 86 comments)
22. Diffusion Models Explained Simply (73 points | 10 comments)
23. So why *did* U.S. wages stagnate for 20 years? (46 points | 39 comments)
24. Rivers (12 points | 2 comments)
25. Edit is now open source (78 points | 27 comments)
26. Visualizing 100k Years of Earth in WebGL (34 points | 10 comments)
27. GitHub Copilot Coding Agent (137 points | 80 comments)
28. SDB Scans the Ruby Stack Without the GVL (27 points | 5 comments)
29. Show HN: Cogitator – A Python Toolkit for Chain-of-Thought Prompting (43 points | 6 comments)
30. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (225 points | 29 comments)
